char* mystrncat ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Appends n characters from string src to the dest sting overwriting the character at the end of dest, and then add a termination character. Destination string must have enough space for result. At most, n+1 characters will be written, accounting for the terminator. *dest String to append to *src String to append onto dest (will not be modified) n number of bytes to copy

Returns:
Poointer to the destination string
Author:
Steven Kordell

char* mystrncpy ( char *  dest,
const char *  src,
size_t  n 
)

Copies at most n bytes of the src string into the dest string. Will not null terminate the string if there is no within the first n bytes. The destination string must be large enough for the source string. If the length of src is less then n, the remainder of dest will be padded with null bytes. dest The string to copy the string too src The string to copy
Number of bytes to copy.

Returns:
A pointer to the desitnation string
Author:
Steven Kordell

char* mystrndup ( const char *  s,
size_t  n 
)

Allocates memory for a string and copies n bytes of the src string into it. If s is longer than n, only n characters are copied and a terminating null byter() is added.

Parameters:
*s Sting to duplicate
n Number of bytes to copy
Returns:
A pointer to the new string
Author:
Steven Kordell
